result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mickey Allen Rader

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mickey Allen Rader in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF241 and 15CF178 @ 3:07 p.m. Agreement stated - Dismiss and read in 15CF178. 15CF241 Def will waive prelim, plead to ct 1, ct 2 dismiss and read in, withheld sentence, 18 months probation, counseling, court costs, AODA. Atty Schuster and Def agree. 15CF241 - Court reviews waiver of prelim. Court finds waiver knowing and voluntary, finds probable cause and binds over. Information filed, copy received, reading waived. Plea quest. reviewed. Plea to ct 1 - no contest. Ct 2 dismissed and read in on motion of State. 15CF178 dismissed and read in on motion of State. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Schuster satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of felony bail jumping as repeater. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court, will follow agreement. Withheld sentence, 18 months probation, AODA and counseling as required, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Atty Schuster will submit a stipulation regarding credit if revoked. Off the record briefly. Back on the record. Jail credit left open at this time. Def advised of voting and firearms restrictions.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights. Def advised to report for booking on this case.

Defendant Mickey Allen Rader in court via video with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Mickey Allen Rader in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 1:42 pm  Bond review requested by Atty Schuster.  Statement by Atty Schuster.  Probation hold will be lifted.  Arguments for bond presented by Atty Schuster.  No objection by State.  Court sets bond.  Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Mickey Allen Rader
Current: 434 1/2 5th Ave, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 09-15-2015)
Prior: W9617 Cr-F, Antigo, WI 54409
